intro: Hieracium pseudoplantagineum, commonly known as the false plantain hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragweed, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by small, bristly seeds. Hieracium pseudoplantagineum is often considered a weed due to its rapid spread and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
